snippet: Sesac, a boutique music rights group, is purchasing the Harry Fox Agency, a move that will allow it to collect fees both when songs are played and when they are sold.
abstract: Sesac announces agreement to buy Harry Fox Agency from National Music Publishers' Assn, which will allow Sesac to combine licensing of songs played on radio or streamed online with licensing of songs published either on CDs or as downloads; deal is yet another signal of how music publishing is evolving and once rigidly defined roles are being adapted to digital music.
lead_paragraph: Sesac, a boutique music rights group, is purchasing the Harry Fox Agency, a move that will allow it to collect fees both when songs are played and when they are sold.

headline.main: Music Publishing Deal Driven by Shift From Sales to Streaming
headline.print_headline: Music Publishing Deal Driven by Shift From Sales to Streaming

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: American Society of Composers, Authors and Publishers
